meanings.definition: To surpass in a competition or comparison.
meanings.sent1: She outvies her classmates in math skills.
meanings.sent2: The athlete outvies all others in speed and agility.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outvies the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outvies any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sun outvies the moon in brightness during the day.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outshine someone or something.
meanings.sent1: His artwork always outvies the others in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The new model of the car outvies its predecessor in fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The clown outvies the magician in making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outvies any material possessions.
meanings.sent5: The stars outvies the city lights in the night sky.
